0.00.text: Hello and welcome back to English with Lucy!

2.50.text: Today I'm going to be answering all of the questions that you sent in

6.56.text: I'm going to be answering questions from my Instagram, my Facebook and my Weibo

11.30.text: So thank you to everybody who asked me a question

13.58.text: And hopefully yours will get answered today

18.36.text: Don't forget to follow me on all of my social media

21.06.text: All of it should be here

22.58.text: I've got my Facebook, my Weibo, my Instagram and my...

28.18.text: Ah! My Youtube channel of course

30.34.text: And, as you might have seen in the last video

32.34.text: I've recently created a Patreon account

36.76.text: This is just a way that you can sponsor my videos

40.32.text: and earn some really nice rewards like skype lessons

45.98.text: And I must say thank you to my first sponsor on there

49.14.text: which is Jaime and he pledged $10

52.50.text: and he will be getting a letter in the post very soon!

55.60.text: OK, Jocanda_ros asks "Can you talk about the myths and realities of the English character?"

64.96.text: OK, let's talk about a couple of the English stereotypes

72.82.text: If there's ever a problem the answer the number one answer is

78.60.text: If you need an important discussion

79.72.text: let's have a cup of tea

81.42.text: It is a big part of British culture

84.34.text: Umm..another one, that we say sorry a lot

88.24.text: Anyone who lives in England or the UK

90.94.text: will realise that we say sorry a lot!

93.34.text: when it's not necessary and when I moved to Spain

95.86.text: I was saying sorry and please and thank you all the time

99.02.text: until one of my friends was saying like

105.04.text: But yeah, a myth...that we're very closed

109.96.text: A lot of the students that I teach in London say

112.48.text: "Oh god, English people are just so unfriendly"

114.48.text: And I don't think that London is a good representation of the UK as a whole

119.70.text: So...I would say that we're very friendly

123.20.text: Maybe not as friendly as some other nationalities but

126.80.text: If you think that English people are unfriendly

129.64.text: You've been meeting the wrong kind of English people

141.16.text: Valesglz says "In terms of culture, what is the best and worst thing of living in Spain and the UK?

149.28.text: about living in Spain and living in the UK

152.40.text: And what are your plans for the future?

154.22.text: OK, the best thing about Spain...well, it's got to be the Spaniards!

159.52.text: I love Spanish people, they are so friendly

163.36.text: so fun and just they know how to have a really good time

167.12.text: and that's basically why I want to live in Spain in the future!

171.24.text: The worst thing about living in Spain was definitely the political corruption

175.46.text: and also the amount of paperwork that you have to do for everything

180.30.text: Just to apply for a simple license or a national insurance number or something like that

186.14.text: You have to spend hours waiting in a queue, you have to fill in a hundred forms

191.18.text: really, in this day and age, it should just be available online!

196.96.text: Ok so Jaime G Patina says

200.32.text: How does a marketer go from ads and pitching to teaching ESL?

205.20.text: When were you aware that you liked teaching as a professional career?

209.20.text: ESL is English as a Second Language

211.52.text: And this is because I used to work in marketing

214.42.text: and my degree was in marketing

217.36.text: I found out that I liked teaching by mistake

221.04.text: I was doing a placement year that went wrong

224.80.text: And I suddenly had no job

226.96.text: I'd done a little bit of teaching before when I was living in Madrid but

231.40.text: I did my teaching qualification at TEFL International Seville

235.42.text: which was great. If anyone wants to do it then definitely do it there

240.60.text: They offered me a job there, I continued on, fell in love with teaching

244.64.text: and because I did marketing and advertising

247.94.text: I wanted to create my own thing

251.58.text: So here I am! Doing it!

255.14.text: Alessio Ghironi says "Hi, do you have natural blond hari?

263.58.text: I've never died my hair before

271.14.text: Actually I was born ginger, but then it changed blonde

274.74.text: and it's always been more or less the same colour so yeah..

278.48.text: The bad thing about having blonde hair is that this happens

284.24.text: That was 20 minutes in the sun!

286.98.text: So yes, I like my hair colour but my skin is very sensitive

299.18.text: I said that with a British accent deliberately cos I don't know how to say that in Portuguese

304.10.text: Really wants me to say something in Portuguese

307.56.text: On this channel. So...I will say....

314.64.text: That's all I know! Umm yeah...
